blog.name: chucksnerdthoughts
blog.title: Chuck's Nerd Thoughts
blog.description: A place for all my nerdy thoughts.

summary: West Coast Avengers #6
title: West Coast Avengers #6
body:
This was a good issue! We got to see all the baddies, so that was nice. Gwen nose punching a bunch of sharks was really fun. Still don’t like how every issue has to have something with her terrible romance, but whatever. I’ve expected it at this point. I liked Kate going back for her team. That makes perfect sense. Still don’t know exactly what’s up with mom, but I’m sure we’ll get some answers at a pivotal moment later in this arc. Super surprised to see Marvel Boy. I don’t even remember the last time I saw him. It might have been that last Young Avengers series. Thinking back, I don’t think I ever finished that run. Regardless, this was a good issue and that was a great twist/surprise!

-Chuck

summary: Misfit Toys - rebelmeg - The Avengers (Marvel Movies) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Misfit Toys - rebelmeg - The Avengers (Marvel Movies) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe
Rating: General Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Characters: Tony Stark, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Clint Barton, Steve Rogers, Thor (Marvel), Bruce Banner, Phil Coulson, Brunnhilde | Valkyrie (Marvel), Nick Fury, Loki (Marvel), Edwin Jarvis
Additional Tags: Toys, Christmas, The Avengers are Toys, Angst with a Happy Ending
Summary:

There is a shelf in the toy shop full of misfit toys that just… don’t fit. Broken, or scary, or not good enough. And they wait and watch, hoping that someday they will have a child to go home with.

Grab a box of tissues, y’all -  @rebelmeg  has gifted us with a lovely holiday story that deserves all the kudos!!!!

summary: Late night thoughts
body:
Late night thoughts

I honestly hate that I’m in the United States right now (for many reasons) but the one reason that bothers me the most at the moment is that I am no where near anyone who speaks with an English accent. This bums me out GREATLY 😭

summary:
Drabble: “My bed’s cold, can I sleep in yours, with you?
Pairing: Hawkeye/Clint Barton x Reader
Word Count: 489
Warnings:...
body:
Middle of the Night

Drabble: “My bed’s cold, can I sleep in yours, with you?

Pairing: Hawkeye/Clint Barton x Reader

Word Count: 489

Warnings: None

Genre: Slight fluff and humor

“Jesus Christ, Clint! What’re you doing?!”

Sleep still clouded your eyes as you watched your friend slowly, and unusually loudly, climbed down from your air ducts. His hair was disheveled from turning around in his bed due to lack of sleep, and through squinted eyes you watched as his face contorted to a sheepish expression as he shifted in his spot. Minutes went by, yet no response, and you let out a small groan as he continued to remain quiet, the frustration from your previous argument only hours before coming back before you turned your back to him. “Go back to your room, Clint.”

“I’m sorry, okay?” The desperation in his voice was enough to keep your eyes from closing, and you heard as his bare feet shuffle against the smooth tile of your floor as he got closer to your bed. “I know I shouldn’t have overreacted but.. can you blame me for being overprotective?”

“Yes,” You were quickly to spring up in your bed as you faced him again, this time your lips pulling into a deep scowl as you glared at him. “I can.” You spat, grabbing the nearest item, which happened to be a small pillow, and chucked it in his direction. Clint’s eyebrows were furrowed together as he ducked out of the way of your pillow, his lips pursing into a pout as he looked to you like a wounded puppy. Now go back to bed; we can discuss this in the morning.”

Clint starred at you like a fish out of water; his eyes wide with shock and his mouth gaping as you turned your back to him once again. Your room went silent as he stood in the dark, only the sound of your heavy, exasperated breath being heard as you tried to calm yourself. “But my bed’s cold,” Clint let out a small whisper as he inched closer to your bed, his hand splaying across your shoulder as he knelt down to look at you better. “can I sleep in yours, with you?” Clint kept his eyes peeled for any movement as he gave your shoulder a small squeeze, his lips pulling up into a small smile when you suddenly let out a small groan.

You kept your eyes shut as you turned your body around to face him, the duvet on your bed becoming twisted around your body in the process. “You’re so annoying, you know that?” You slowly peeled your eyes open, and despite the darkness that covered your room you still saw the puppy-like face that Clint was sporting, to which you rolled your eyes in response. You never could stay mad at Clint, and the both of you knew that, which only added on to the smugness that Clint kept to himself when you finally nodded your head slowly. “Fine. But when I wake up I’m gonna be mad again.”

“I wouldn’t expect you to not be.”

Clint starred at you like a fish out of water; his eyes wide with shock and his mouth gaping as you turned your back to him once again. Your room went silent as he stood in the dark, only the sound of your heavy, exasperated breath being heard as you tried to calm yourself. “But my bed’s cold,” Clint let out a small whisper as he inched closer to your bed, his hand splaying across your shoulder as he knelt down to look at you better. “can I sleep in yours, with you?” Clint kept his eyes peeled for any movement as he gave your shoulder a small squeeze, his lips pulling up into a small smile when you suddenly let out a small groan.

You kept your eyes shut as you turned your body around to face him, the duvet on your bed becoming twisted around your body in the process. “You’re so annoying, you know that?” You slowly peeled your eyes open, and despite the darkness that covered your room you still saw the puppy-like face that Clint was sporting, to which you rolled your eyes in response. You never could stay mad at Clint, and the both of you knew that, which only added on to the smugness that Clint kept to himself when you finally nodded your head slowly. “Fine. But when I wake up I’m gonna be mad again.”

“I wouldn’t expect you to not be.”
